content.description: Start just left of the arete. Climb to the obvious flake and make a hard layback move to the base of the roof. From here step around and climb the right side of the arete past two more bolts to the top.
Sit-start at the back, climb out slopers on the right side of the roof and then mantle over the tip.
content.location: Right hand side of the Mullet Buttress

content.description: Best v3 in the world.    This problem starts on a good pinched block at it's base. Sidepull out to two jugs out right. Reach up big for a huge pinch sloper with your right. Go out with your left for the left arete and move out to the end of the prow for the crux and the tricky top out.
content.location: At the end of the Mullet buttress wall is the obvious prow, right in front of the "Land of the Lost" sign.

content.description: A slightly overhanging start leads to two bulges. The tricky crux comes at the second bulge and the last bolt. Looks like slab climbing from the ground, but feels overhung while pulling the move.
content.protection: Six bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The first route to the right of Party in the Back, which is the route with the tires hanging above the start.

content.description: Left trending, sustained and slightly overhanging climbing on some of the biggest holds at the ranch.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The start is located right underneath the hanging tires at the Mullet Buttress.

content.description: Face climb on the rightmost side of the boulder with a crux at the first bolt.
content.location: About 15 feet left of Tongue Lash
North (left if you are facing the wall) of the wide chimney system on the Mullet Buttress and around the corner. Start in front of a small cave.

content.description: Good sustained face climb up a dark streak
content.location: Look for the obvious dark streak in the middle of the wall

climbs.name: Joe Dirt
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbie, Tom Hancock, Tim Slover, 2013

content.description: Start right of Pimp-Ass Midgiemullet on orange rock. Pull small roof on jugs then traverse left after the second bolt and head up the obvious gritty black streak.
content.location: Orange rock in between the two black streaks

content.description: Make a reachy move past the first bolt. Moderate climbing entails until the crux move just below the anchors. This route was originally led on gear.
content.location: Just right of the wide chimney system ("Bow Flex").

content.description: Start by climbing up to a big ledge, then finish on sustained overhanging climbing with big holds.
content.protection: Four bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The first bolted route to the left of Party in the Back, which is right underneath the hanging tires.

content.description: There are several high quality routes at the Mullet Buttress, but there are rarely many climbers. It could be due to the large sticker bushes at the bases during the summer months, but it is easy enough to avoid them.
